name: Introduction to Zoology
description: This course provides an overview of the field of zoology and its sub-disciplines, including Ethology. It covers principles of animal structure and function, behavior, ecology, and evolution.

name: Animal Behavior
description: This course introduces students to the study of animal behavior. It covers topics such as learning, communication, mating behavior, and social behavior.

name: Animal Physiology
description: This course introduces students to the physiology of animals, including the structure and function of cells, tissues, and organ systems. It covers principles of metabolism, nutrition, gas exchange, circulation, and excretion.

name: Animal Ecology
description: This course introduces students to the study of animal populations in their environment, including the effects of physical and biological factors on populations and communities. It covers topics such as population dynamics, competition, predation, and adaptation.

name: Ethology
description: This course introduces students to the study of animal behavior, with a focus on evolutionary explanations for behavior. It covers topics such as instinctive behavior, learning, communication, mating behavior, and social behavior.
